definition: copper (chemistry)/see also 紅銅|红铜[hong2 tong2]/CL:塊|块[kuai4]
(bird species of China) bronzed drongo (Dicrurus aeneus)

sentences.english: If you want a tan, you should lie in the sun for a little while.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要曬成古銅色，你應該在太陽下躺一會兒。

sentences.english: All were tanned to the color of bronze from wind and sun.
sentences.chinese: 因爲風吹日曬，大家都曬成了古銅色。

sentences.english: His face had been bronzed by the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他的臉被太陽曬成古銅色。

sentences.english: Description: A bronzed mask with fabric back.
sentences.chinese: 後面是布的一個古銅色的面具。

sentences.english: Subtle bronzer was key to help add warmth to her skin.
sentences.chinese: 奇妙的古銅色化妝品是幫助增添皮膚溫暖度的關鍵。

sentences.english: The guys should have the bronzed skin.
sentences.chinese: 男性應該有古銅色的皮膚。

sentences.english: A blush mantled over the bronzed cheek of the gladiator.
sentences.chinese: 鬥士古銅色的臉膛頓時漲得通紅。

sentences.english: A bronze statue with feet of clay.
sentences.chinese: 與原形畢露的一個古銅色雕像。

sentences.english: The street-facing facade is punctured by large windows with deep bronzed frames.
sentences.chinese: 面向街道的立面上穿插着有深古銅色窗框的大窗戶。

sentences.english: No matter use on white or bronze skin all can make-up perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 無論塗在白晳或古銅色的肌膚上，效果均完美迷人。

sentences.english: To electroplate the color of underside into bronze.
City people wanted this bronzer, said that the skin is healthy.
sentences.chinese: 城裏人卻嚮往這種古銅色，說這樣的膚色才健康。

sentences.english: The beach is a good place to get a suntan .
sentences.chinese: 海灘是個讓皮膚曬成古銅色的好地方。

sentences.english: Frames are in bronzed nickel steel.
The lure of bronzed skin is not worth dying for, is it?
sentences.chinese: 古銅色皮膚的誘惑還不足以讓你爲此去冒險吧？

sentences.english: We still call the copper-colored natives of the New World Indians.
sentences.chinese: 我們仍把新大陸古銅色皮膚的土著稱作印度人。
